|religion = Roman Catholicism |website = [http://www.liamfox.co.uk
www.liamfox.co.uk] }} 'Liam Fox' (born 22 September 1961) is a British
Conservative politician, Member of Parliament for North Somerset, and former
Secretary of State for Defence.

Fox studied medicine at the University of Glasgow and worked as a GP and
Civilian Army Medical Officer before being elected as an MP in 1992.
After holding several ministerial roles in John Major's Conservative government,
Fox served as Constitutional Affairs Spokesman (1998â1999), Shadow Health
Secretary (1999â2003), Conservative Party chairman (2003â05), Shadow Foreign
Secretary (2005) and Shadow Defence Secretary (2005â10).

Fox stood unsuccessfully in the 2005 Conservative leadership election. In 2010,
he was appointed Secretary of State for Defence, a position from which he
resigned on 14 October 2011 over allegations that he had given a close friend,
lobbyist Adam Werritty, access to the Ministry of Defence and allowed him to
join official trips overseas.
